{"step_by_step_thinking": "A child transferring objects from one hand to the other is a common activity that is usually observed during the developmental stage of 12-24 months. This activity implies visual motor co-ordination as it requires the coordination of the visual system, hands and eyes. The child needs to see where the object is located, reach for it, grasp it, and transfer it from one hand to another, all while maintaining eye-hand coordination.", "answer_choice": "A"}
